definition: not to mind taking all the trouble (idiom)/to take great pains/to be very patient
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: Because of the smell of solicitation in the air, and because we are usually in the middle of it.
sentences.chinese: 而是由于不厌其烦的教唆，而且我们经常置身于其中。

sentences.english: Given an audience with President Lincoln, he discoursed at length on the high and ancient nobility of his distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他不厌其烦细说自己家世显赫，自古就是高门贵族。

sentences.english: She adjusted her coloured head scarf fussily…
sentences.chinese: 她不厌其烦地调弄着自己的彩色头巾。

sentences.english: But let's take baby steps to get there.
sentences.chinese: 当时还是让我们不厌其烦地到达那一步吧。

sentences.english: Thank you FOR the trouble you have taken in reading over the manuscript FOR me.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你不厌其烦地替我审阅这个稿子。

sentences.english: I’m glossing over the specific details, but I think you get the idea.
sentences.chinese: 不厌其烦的重复这些细节，但我相信你会理解的。

sentences.english: Smoking is bad for you,as experts never weary of reminding us.
sentences.chinese: 专家总是不厌其烦地提醒我们，吸烟对人体有害。

sentences.english: Businesspeople complain endlessly about public-sector education and training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 商业人士不厌其烦的抱怨公立机构的教育和培训项目。

definition: earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
to chatter or jabber on and on
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)
to give sincere advice (idiom)/to exhort earnestly
